title: Quick Fideo Recipe
description: Mexican spaghetti, also known as fideo, is simmered with ground beef and plenty of spices creating a quick weeknight dinner.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Quick Fideo 4.2 (22) 19 Reviews 12 Photos This is a delicious Mexican variation of fideo, Mexican spaghetti. Submitted by Mindy Updated on November 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 12 12 12 12 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 pound ground beef 3 tablespoons dried minced onion, divided 2 tablespoons garlic powder, divided salt and ground black pepper to taste ¼ cup canola oil 1 (16 ounce) package fideo noodles 3 cups hot water, or as needed 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce 2 tablespoons ground cumin 2 tablespoons onion powder 1 cube beef bouillon 3 thin strips of green bell pepper Directions Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef, 1 tablespoon dried onion, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, salt, and black pepper in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Transfer beef to a bowl. Heat canola oil in the same skillet over medium heat; cook and stir fideo noodles in the hot oil until browned, 3 to 5 minutes. Add ground beef and enough hot water to cover the noodles; stir in tomato sauce, 2 tablespoons dried onion, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, cumin, onion powder, beef bouillon, green bell pepper, salt, and black pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender, 10 to 15 minutes. I Made It Print 28 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 412 Calories 17g Fat 46g Carbs 18g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 412 % Daily Value * Total Fat 17g 22% Saturated Fat 4g 21% Cholesterol 35mg 12% Sodium 296mg 13% Total Carbohydrate 46g 17% Dietary Fiber 3g 12% Total Sugars 3g Protein 18g 35% Vitamin C 5mg 5% Calcium 46mg 4% Iron 4mg 24% Potassium 345mg 7% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Add Your Photo Photos of Quick Fideo 01 of 12 Photo by  lisalynn 02 of 12 Photo by  Lela 09/23/2024 The fideo was okay. I used angel hair pasta, but vermicelli could be used. I would suggest using a dutch oven to sauté the pasta. The recipe doesn't tell you how to prepare the pasta. You need to break the pasta into 1 to 2 inch pieces. I put it in a ziplock bag to break the pasta. Breaking the pasta will prevent the pasta from flying all over your stove. Heat the pan to medium low. Also, I used a spatula to turn over the pasta to prevent it from burning. Something was missing from this recipe. Instead of using tomato sauce, I would use a small can of tomato paste. 03 of 12 Photo by  1010lisalynn 09/14/2024 Superb Flavor!Superb flavor, but what is it? Soup, stew, a pasta dish.?I love fideo soup, but this isn’t really like that. Quick and simplistic this dish is indeed but not like any fideo soup I’ve made or eaten at a Mexican restaurant! No fresh ingredients like onions, cilantro, tomatoes etc.I halved this recipe and still twice water needed to be added, more and more as if I was making risotto.Since this recipe title states “Quick Fideo” I used most of the ingredients and cooking time as listed to keep it timely. Originally, I cooked a tube of Mexican chorizo, but it was too mealy. So, I chopped up and warmed some beef polish sausage and made with the recipe as listed. Other small changes I made were using onion soup mix in place of dried onion and orange and yellow bell pepper strip substitutes for green bell pepper, still not sure why a bell pepper strip was in the recipe unless for color and simplicity.My husband is excited to have leftovers!!! 04 of 12 Photo by  lupini 09/08/2024 Might try again Needs more flavor Fideo! I bought the fideo was just a type of pasta. I didn’t know that it was the name of a recipe! I love the Dayo noodles when I make chicken soup. It reminds me of the Christmas soup my mom and grandmother would make.This is a very simple recipe. I followed it exactly except for for some reason I thought there was cut up fresh tomatoes in it. I actually put fresh tomatoes in it. I don’t think it took away from the original recipe. In fact it was pretty good. I am thinking of trying it sometime ground sausage and browning it instead of the ground meat. It’s a very good quick meal. The browning of the Fido is necessary because it adds some taste to it that wouldn’t be there otherwise. So please don’t skip that step. This seems like a good meal to feed little kids because it has spaghetti in it. 05 of 12 Photo by  Andrea Herring Jasper 02/19/2022 It’s pretty good. I used angel hair pasta and adjusted it for two people. Added a couple of different spices (don’t remember what) and next time maybe I’ll follow the recipe more closely 😏 06 of 12 Photo by  Keisha Scott 12/28/2019 07 of 12 Photo by  Norma Gabriella Pena 07/05/2019 I love it!!! Instead of 16oz fideo I used the 7oz. Still game out good and plenty !! Thanks for the recipe!!! 08 of 12 Photo by  Kimmy Krew 02/02/2019 09 of 12 Photo by  Melindark 02/04/2018 10 of 12 Photo by  micho 10/17/2016 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Mexican Mostaccioli 56 Ratings Mexican Lasagna Roll Ups 1 Rating Mexican Lasagna Rollups 34 Ratings Taco Macaroni Skillet 8 Ratings Noodles Mexicana 40 Ratings Mexican Lasagna 607 Ratings Taco Lasagna 591 Ratings Tacos in Pasta Shells 1,039 Ratings That's Good Moosh! 10 Ratings Citrus Asada Fajitas 3 Ratings Mom's Carne Guisada 66 Ratings Fideo (Mexican Spaghetti) 140 Ratings Throw Together Mexican Casserole 207 Ratings Instant Pot Mexican Beef Taco Filling 1 Rating Chili Casserole 138 Ratings Hamburger Casserole 413 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Mindy
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef, 1 tablespoon dried onion, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, salt, and black pepper in the hot skillet until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Transfer beef to a bowl.;Heat canola oil in the same skillet over medium heat; cook and stir fideo noodles in the hot oil until browned, 3 to 5 minutes. Add ground beef and enough hot water to cover the noodles; stir in tomato sauce, 2 tablespoons dried onion, 1 tablespoon garlic powder, cumin, onion powder, beef bouillon, green bell pepper, salt, and black pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until noodles are tender, 10 to 15 minutes.
